title.rendered: Why Canon Pixma Tr8520 Keeps Going Offline?

content.rendered:
Do you have a Canon Pixma tr8520 printer? Well, the printer is amazing and known for its HD printer, mind-blowing color definitions, easy use, and so many other features. This Canon printer is best for office use as well as for home use. You can the printer at your office for the staff, so that they can get amazing prints to make presentations, to send HD fax copies to the clients, and when you put this at home, it helps you in your work as well as, allow you, kids, also to get clear and colorful prints for their school projects. It can help your wife to decorate the house walls with cool pictures. Now you can see how many words can be done with just one printer.

Have you ever thought that if your printer stop working how will you do all these things? Printers are machines and sometimes during their life at least once they fail to perform. The printer also goes offline sometimes, and if your Pixma tr8520 Canon printer is showing offline notification than you can fix it with simple steps.

Here in this blog, we are going to tell about the troubleshooting steps for the Canon tr8520 printer users how are getting offline issue again and again. After applying the steps the error will get vanish from your printer.

So let us start the guide to remove the offline error.

Table of Contents

  • Bring Your Canon Pixma Tr8520 Printer Online
    • Step 1: Remove Printing Jobs
    • Step 2: Change Printer Status
    • Step 3: Reinstall The Printer Drivers

Bring Your Canon Pixma Tr8520 Printer Online

Follow the below simple steps to change the status of your Canon printer from offline to online. First, you need to check a few things before starting with troubleshooting steps:

  1. Check if the printer is ON or should be not in the sleep mode.
  2. Check to ensure that both the ends of the USB cable are firmly inserted.
  3. Make sure that the printer is getting a complete network.
  4. Ensure that you have to download the right printer drivers and they are updated.
  5. If you have installed new Windows, then make sure to update the drivers according to it.
  6. Check if there is any Paper-jam issue.

Now let’s see troubleshooting steps

Step 1: Remove Printing Jobs

  1. Click the Start button or Windows icon
  2. Now choose Settings
  3. Then select Devices in the Settings window
  4. Click Printers and Scanners
  5. Now select your printer and right-click on it.
  6. In the drop-down menu open “See what’s printing”
  7. Then select all the previous printing jobs and delete them.

Step 2: Change Printer Status

  1. Open Printers and Scanners window
  2. Again select your printer and right-click
  3. This time select Printer and choose- “Use printer online” option.

This will surely make your printer come online and then you can again try getting prints from the Canon printer. However, it still shows the printer offline issue then uninstall the printer drivers.

Step 3: Reinstall The Printer Drivers

  1. To uninstall the printer driver open Printer Server Properties window
  2. Now remove the printer driver
  3. Once it gets uninstall completely
  4. Now open Printers and Scanners window again and add printer
  5. Then install the Printer drivers for your printer.

This step is the last option to solve the printer errors, and while solving the Canon Pixma tr8520 printer offline issue you can use this method to again make your printer online. While turning your Canon printer offline to online, you may face issues. However, if you are getting another issue or not able to resolve this canon printer offline error, then you can contact the experts for quick help.

As Canon printers experts are professionals and trained they know very well how to solve the error that generally Canon printer faces. Canon printer offline issue is the major issue for the users because after this technical error they are unable to use it. They cannot get prints, cannot scan copies, or send the fax. The offline error can only ve rectified by either following troubleshooting steps, or by taking technician’s help.
